item.title: Only allowing 1 connection from an ip
item.dc:creator: @mochronik mochronik
item.description:
@mochronik wrote:

i did what u said and i have it all correct:

	  for(int i = 0; i < server.playerHandler.players.length; i++){
		  Player p = server.playerHandler.players[i]; if(p != null &&
		  !p.disconnected && p.connectedFrom.equals(connectedFrom) &&
		  playerId != p.playerId && !connectedFrom.equals("localhost") && !checkLog("connect", connectedFrom)){
		  sM("Address in use!"); returnCode = 9; disconnected =
		  true; return; } }

but still lets me and others through more than 1 account at same time… please help som1?

item.source: Only allowing 1 connection from an ip

item.title: Only allowing 1 connection from an ip
item.dc:creator: @Aintaro Aintaro
item.description:
@Aintaro wrote:

Yeah, i can help you here, its not hard at all if you got a deltasource…here we go

Go in client.java and search for :

sM("Address in use!"); returnCode = 9; disconnected =

Than you should see this :


/*for(int i = 0; i < server.playerHandler.players.length; i++){Player p = server.playerHandler.players[i]; if(p != null &&!p.disconnected && p.connectedFrom.equals(connectedFrom) &&playerId != p.playerId && !connectedFrom.equals("192.168.0.149") && !checkLog("donators", playerName)){sM("Address in use!"); returnCode = 9; disconnected =true; return; } }*/

replace it with this :

for(int i = 0; i < server.playerHandler.players.length; i++){ Player p = server.playerHandler.players[i]; if(p != null && !p.disconnected && p.connectedFrom.equals(connectedFrom) && playerId != p.playerId && !connectedFrom.equals("localhost") && !checkLog("connect", connectedFrom)){ sM("Address in use!"); returnCode = 9; disconnected = true; return; } }

thats for 1 connection per ip. also stops syipkpkers

easy tut, and it gets you rid of all those stupid syipkpkers =)

Read full topic
